title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: process exploratory analysis cross-sectional longitudinal configurations. First, execute Single Site, Exploratory, Cross-Sectional analysis, configured appropriately study, data source. , combine results single table different sites delineated site column.
code: library(conceptsetdistribution)  my_table <- csd_process(cohort = my_cohort,                         multi_or_single_site = 'single',                         anomaly_or_exploratory = 'exploratory',                         time = T / F,                         ...) my_final_results <- my_table1 %>% dplyr::union(my_table2) ... %>%   dplyr::union(my_table_n)

title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: anomaly detection analysis, start executing steps exploratory analysis. , execute relevant anomaly detection algorithm resulting table. See different processes cross-sectional longitudinal analysis.

title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: cross-sectional analysis, compute_dist_anomalies detect_outliers functions, available squba.gen package, executed results. Copy code , inputting table generated. using OMOP CDM, concept_id input concept column. PCORnet CDM, concept_code input concept column. p_value can selected user.
code: # First execute the compute_dist_anomalies function df_start <- compute_dist_anomalies(df_tbl = my_table,                                    grp_vars = c('variable', concept_column),                                    var_col = 'prop_concept',                                    denom_cols = c('variable', 'ct_denom'))  # Then, use that output as input for the detect_outliers function df_final <- detect_outliers(df_tbl = df_start,                             tail_input = 'both',                             p_input = p_value,                             column_analysis = 'prop_concept',                             column_variable = concept_column)

what: Examine the Distribution of Concept Representation
title: Examine the Distribution of Concept Representation
text: Concept Set Distribution Concept Set Testing module summarizes usage different codes within user-provided concept set. allows user investigate, given study variable definition, specific concepts (ex: ICD10, LOINC) driving cohort inclusion.

title: Examine the Distribution of Concept Representation
text: can install development version package like :
code: devtools::install_github('ssdqa/conceptsetdistribution')

title: Base CSD function — check_code_dist_csd_omop
text: Base CSD function

title: Base CSD function — check_code_dist_csd_omop
code: check_code_dist_csd_omop(   cohort_codedist,   concept_set,   time = FALSE,   time_span,   time_period,   domain_tbl = conceptsetdistribution::csd_domain_file )

title: Base CSD function — check_code_dist_csd_omop
text: cohort_codedist cohort interest concept_set annotated concept set CSV file following columns: concept_id required OMOP; concept_id interest concept_code required PCORnet; code interest concept_name optional; descriptive name concept vocabulary_id required PCORnet; vocabulary code - match listed domain table's vocabulary_field variable required; string label grouping one concept code larger variable definition domain required; name CDM table concept stored - multiple domains can included file, one domain listed per row time logical determine whether output check across time time_span time = TRUE, vector two dates observation period study time_period time = TRUE, argument defines distance dates within specified time period. defaults year, time periods month week also acceptable domain_tbl input table defining domains listed annotated concept set four columns: - domain name CDM table associated concept; match listed annotated concept set - concept_field name field domain table concepts located - date_field name field domain table date used time-based filtering - vocabulary_field PCORnet ; set NA

title: Base CSD function — check_code_dist_csd_omop
text: returns variable concept mappings, counts proportions; time = TRUE, output given across time, proportions computed within variable

title: Base CSD function — check_code_dist_csd_pcnt
text: Base CSD function

title: Base CSD function — check_code_dist_csd_pcnt
code: check_code_dist_csd_pcnt(   cohort_codedist,   concept_set,   time = FALSE,   time_span,   time_period,   domain_tbl = conceptsetdistribution::csd_domain_file )

title: Base CSD function — check_code_dist_csd_pcnt
text: cohort_codedist cohort pass concept_set concept set passed csd_process; concept set CSV file following columns: concept_id | concept_code | concept_name | vocabulary_id | category | variable | domain variable field required categorize concept set particular variable domain required function knows table join order derive counts time logical determine whether output check across time time_span time = TRUE, vector two dates observation period study time_period time = TRUE, argument defines distance dates within specified time period. defaults year, time periods month week also acceptable domain_tbl domain table passed csd_process; tbl similar SCV check; four columns: domain | source_col | concept_col | date_col; required columns csd check domain_tbl, concept_col, date_col

title: Base CSD function — check_code_dist_csd_pcnt
text: returns variable concept mappings, counts proportions; time = TRUE, output given across time, proportions computed within variable

text: cohort_codedist cohort pass concept_set concept set passed csd_process; concept set CSV file following columns: concept_id | concept_code | concept_name | vocabulary_id | category | variable | domain variable field required categorize concept set particular variable domain required function knows table join order derive counts num_concept_combined mult_or_single_site = single anomaly_or_exploratory = anomaly, argument integer ensure concept1 concept2 meet minimal threshold including jaccard index; TRUE, conditions num_concept_1 num_concept_2 met; FALSE just one condition needs met. num_concept_1 mult_or_single_site = single anomaly_or_exploratory = anomaly, argument integer requires minimum number times first concept appears dataset num_concept_2 mult_or_single_site = single anomaly_or_exploratory = anomaly, argument integer requires minimum number times second concept appears dataset domain_tbl domain table passed csd_process; tbl similar SCV check; four columns: domain | source_col | concept_col | date_col; required columns csd check domain_tbl, concept_col, date_col

title: CSD Sample Domain File — csd_domain_file
text: data frame 3 columns domain name CDM table associated domain concept interest can found. match domain listed concept_set file. concept_field name column domain table contains concepts interest listed concept_set file. date_field name column domain table contains dates used time-based filtering. vocabulary_field (PCORnet ) name column domain table vocabulary type stored

title: Multi-Site, Anomaly, Cross-Sectional — csd_ms_anom_cs
text: process_output output csd_process concept_col name column concept_set used identify concepts either concept_id concept_code text_wrapping_char number characters concept_name concept_id display heatmap; limited 80 filtered_var variable perform analysis data frame; column name contains variable names labeled variable comparison_col column computes quantitative value comparison across sites; csd check, prop_concept large_n boolean indicating whether large N visualization, intended high volume sites, used; defaults FALSE large_n_sites vector site names can optionally generate filtered visualization

title: Multi-Site, Anomaly, Cross-Sectional — csd_ms_anom_cs

what: Concept Set Distribution – Output Generation — csd_output
title: Concept Set Distribution – Output Generation — csd_output
text: Using tabular output generated csd_process, function build graph visualize results. function configuration output bespoke ggplot. Theming can adjusted user graph output using + theme(). graphs can also made interactive using make_interactive_squba()

title: Concept Set Distribution – Output Generation — csd_output
code: csd_output(   process_output,   concept_set = NULL,   vocab_tbl = NULL,   num_variables = 10,   num_mappings = 10,   filter_variable = NULL,   filter_concept = NULL,   text_wrapping_char = 80,   output_value = "prop_concept",   large_n = FALSE,   large_n_sites = NULL )

title: Concept Set Distribution – Output Generation — csd_output
text: process_output tabular input || required tabular output produced csd_process concept_set tabular input || optional concept set originally used csd_process function. Recommended vocab_tbl provided concept names available concept set. vocab_tbl tabular input || optional vocabulary table containing concept names provided codes (ex: OMOP concept table) num_variables integer || defaults 30 integer indicating top N variables include exploratory analyses. function choose commonly occurring N variables include plot. num_mappings integer || defaults 30 integer indicating top N concepts include exploratory analyses. function choose commonly occurring N concepts per variable include plot. filter_variable string vector || defaults NULL specific variable(s) display output. parameter required following check types: Single Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional Multi Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional Single Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal Single Site, Anomaly Detection, Longitudinal Multi Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal filter_concept numeric/string vector || defaults NULL specific code(s) display output. parameter required following check types: Single Site, Anomaly Detection, Longitudinal Multi Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal Multi Site, Anomaly Detection, Longitudinal text_wrapping_char integer || defaults 80 integer indicating length limit text axis wrapping enforced. used Multi Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional check type output_value string || defaults prop_concept name numerical column process_output used output. parameter required following check types: Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional Single Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal Multi-Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal large_n boolean || defaults FALSE Multi-Site analyses, boolean indicating whether large N visualization, intended high volume sites, used. visualization produce high level summaries across sites, option add specific site comparators via large_n_sites parameter. large_n_sites vector || defaults NULL large_n = TRUE, vector site names can add site-level information plot comparison across high level summary information.

title: Concept Set Distribution – Output Generation — csd_output
text: function produce graph visualize results csd_process based parameters provided. default output typically static ggplot gt object, interactive elements can activated passing plot make_interactive_squba. detailed description output specific check type, see PEDSpace metadata repository

title: Concept Set Distribution – Output Generation — csd_output
code: #' Source setup file source(system.file('setup.R', package = 'conceptsetdistribution'))  #' Create in-memory RSQLite database using data in extdata directory conn <- mk_testdb_omop()  #' Establish connection to database and generate internal configurations initialize_dq_session(session_name = 'csd_process_test',                       working_directory = getwd(),                       db_conn = conn,                       is_json = FALSE,                       file_subdirectory = system.file('extdata',                                         package = 'conceptsetdistribution'),                       cdm_schema = NA) #> Connected to: :memory:@NA #> To see environment settings, run `get_argos_default()`  #' Build mock study cohort cohort <- cdm_tbl('person') %>% dplyr::distinct(person_id) %>%   dplyr::mutate(start_date = as.Date(-5000),                 #RSQLite does not store date objects,                 #hence the numerics                 end_date = as.Date(15000),                 site = ifelse(person_id %in% c(1:6), 'synth1', 'synth2'))  #' Prepare input tables csd_domain_tbl <- dplyr::tibble(domain = 'condition_occurrence',                                 concept_field = 'condition_concept_id',                                 date_field = 'condition_start_date',                                 vocabulary_field = NA)  csd_concept_tbl <- read_codeset('dx_hypertension') %>%   dplyr::mutate(domain = 'condition_occurrence',                 variable = 'hypertension') #> Error: '/home/runner/work/conceptsetdistribution/conceptsetdistribution/docs/reference//home/runner/work/_temp/Library/conceptsetdistribution/extdata/dx_hypertension.csv' does not exist.  #' Execute `csd_process` function #' This example will use the single site, exploratory, cross sectional #' configuration csd_process_example <- csd_process(cohort = cohort,                                    multi_or_single_site = 'single',                                    anomaly_or_exploratory = 'exploratory',                                    time = FALSE,                                    omop_or_pcornet = 'omop',                                    domain_tbl = csd_domain_tbl,                                    concept_set = csd_concept_tbl) #> Error: object 'csd_concept_tbl' not found  csd_process_example #> Error: object 'csd_process_example' not found  #' Execute `csd_output` function csd_output_example <- csd_output(process_output = csd_process_example,                                  concept_set = csd_concept_tbl,                                  vocab_tbl = NULL) #> Error: object 'csd_process_example' not found  csd_output_example #> Error: object 'csd_output_example' not found  #' Easily convert the graph into an interactive ggiraph or plotly object with #' `make_interactive_squba()`  make_interactive_squba(csd_output_example[[1]]) #> Error: object 'csd_output_example' not found

title: Concept Set Distribution — csd_process
text: information representation module compute distribution concept usage user-provided annotated concept set. user define domains interest (domain_tbl) provide concept set evaluated (concept_set). Sample versions inputs included data package accessible conceptsetdistribution::. Results can optionally stratified site, age group, /time. function compatible OMOP PCORnet CDMs based user's selection.

title: Concept Set Distribution — csd_process
code: csd_process(   cohort,   domain_tbl = conceptsetdistribution::csd_domain_file,   concept_set = conceptsetdistribution::csd_concept_set,   omop_or_pcornet,   multi_or_single_site = "single",   anomaly_or_exploratory = "exploratory",   num_concept_combined = FALSE,   num_concept_1 = 30,   num_concept_2 = 30,   p_value = 0.9,   age_groups = NULL,   time = FALSE,   time_span = c("2012-01-01", "2020-01-01"),   time_period = "year" )

title: Concept Set Distribution — csd_process
text: cohort tabular input || required cohort used data quality testing. table contain, minimum: site | character | name(s) institutions included cohort person_id / patid | integer / character | patient identifier start_date | date | start cohort period end_date | date | end cohort period Note start end dates included table used limit search window analyses module. domain_tbl tabular input || required table CSV file defining domains listed annotated concept set. input contain four columns: domain | character | string identifying CDM table, listed annotated concept set, concept interest can identified concept_field | character| string name field domain table concepts located date_field | character |  name field domain table date used temporal filtering vocabulary_field | character | PCORnet applications, name field domain table vocabulary identifier differentiate concepts one another (ex: dx_type); can set NA OMOP applications see example input look like, see ?conceptsetdistribution::csd_domain_file concept_set tabular input || required table CSV containing concepts investigated, plus additional metadata. input contain one following: concept_id | integer | concept_id interest (required OMOP) concept_code | character | code interest (required PCORnet) : variable | character | string label grouping one concept code larger variable definition domain | character | name CDM table concept can found certain PCORnet applications, also contain vocabulary_id | character | vocabulary code, match listed domain table's vocabulary_field see example input look like, see ?conceptsetdistribution::csd_concept_set omop_or_pcornet string || required string, either omop pcornet, indicating CDM format data omop: run csd_process_omop() function OMOP CDM instance pcornet: run csd_process_pcornet() function PCORnet CDM instance multi_or_single_site string || defaults single string, either single multi, indicating whether single-site multi-site analysis executed anomaly_or_exploratory string || defaults exploratory string, either anomaly exploratory, indicating type results produced. Exploratory analyses give high level summary data examine fact representation within cohort. Anomaly detection analyses specialized identify outliers within cohort. num_concept_combined boolean || defaults FALSE multi_or_single_site = single anomaly_or_exploratory = anomaly, argument boolean ensure concept1 concept2 meet minimal threshold inclusion Jaccard index computation. TRUE, conditions num_concept_1 num_concept_2 met; FALSE just one condition needs met. num_concept_1 integer || defaults 30 multi_or_single_site = single anomaly_or_exploratory = anomaly, argument indicates minimum number times first concept appears dataset Jaccard index computation num_concept_2 integer || defaults 30 multi_or_single_site = single anomaly_or_exploratory = anomaly, argument indicates minimum number times second concept appears dataset Jaccard index computation p_value numeric || defaults 0.9 p value used threshold Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional analysis age_groups tabular input || defaults NULL like stratify results age group, create table CSV file following columns use input parameter: min_age | integer | minimum age group (.e. 10) max_age | integer | maximum age group (.e. 20) group | character | string label group (.e. 10-20, Young Adult, etc.) like stratify age group, leave NULL time boolean || defaults FALSE boolean indicate whether execute longitudinal analysis time_span vector - length 2 || defaults c('2012-01-01', '2020-01-01') vector indicating lower upper bounds time series longitudinal analyses time_period string || defaults year string indicating distance dates within specified time_span. Defaults year, time periods month week also acceptable

title: Concept Set Distribution — csd_process
text: function return dataframe summarizing distribution code usage user defined variable. detailed description output specific check type, see PEDSpace metadata repository

title: Concept Set Distribution — csd_process
code: #' Source setup file source(system.file('setup.R', package = 'conceptsetdistribution'))  #' Create in-memory RSQLite database using data in extdata directory conn <- mk_testdb_omop()  #' Establish connection to database and generate internal configurations initialize_dq_session(session_name = 'csd_process_test',                       working_directory = getwd(),                       db_conn = conn,                       is_json = FALSE,                       file_subdirectory = system.file('extdata',                                         package = 'conceptsetdistribution'),                       cdm_schema = NA) #> Connected to: :memory:@NA #> To see environment settings, run `get_argos_default()`  #' Build mock study cohort cohort <- cdm_tbl('person') %>% dplyr::distinct(person_id) %>%   dplyr::mutate(start_date = as.Date(-5000),                 #RSQLite does not store date objects,                 #hence the numerics                 end_date = as.Date(15000),                 site = ifelse(person_id %in% c(1:6), 'synth1', 'synth2'))  #' Prepare input tables csd_domain_tbl <- dplyr::tibble(domain = 'condition_occurrence',                                 concept_field = 'condition_concept_id',                                 date_field = 'condition_start_date',                                 vocabulary_field = NA)  csd_concept_tbl <- read_codeset('dx_hypertension') %>%   dplyr::mutate(domain = 'condition_occurrence',                 variable = 'hypertension') #> Error: '/home/runner/work/conceptsetdistribution/conceptsetdistribution/docs/reference//home/runner/work/_temp/Library/conceptsetdistribution/extdata/dx_hypertension.csv' does not exist.  #' Execute `csd_process` function #' This example will use the single site, exploratory, cross sectional #' configuration csd_process_example <- csd_process(cohort = cohort,                                    multi_or_single_site = 'single',                                    anomaly_or_exploratory = 'exploratory',                                    time = FALSE,                                    omop_or_pcornet = 'omop',                                    domain_tbl = csd_domain_tbl,                                    concept_set = csd_concept_tbl) #> Error: object 'csd_concept_tbl' not found  csd_process_example #> Error: object 'csd_process_example' not found  #' Execute `csd_output` function csd_output_example <- csd_output(process_output = csd_process_example,                                  concept_set = csd_concept_tbl,                                  vocab_tbl = NULL) #> Error: object 'csd_process_example' not found  csd_output_example #> Error: object 'csd_output_example' not found  #' Easily convert the graph into an interactive ggiraph or plotly object with #' `make_interactive_squba()`  make_interactive_squba(csd_output_example[[1]]) #> Error: object 'csd_output_example' not found

what: Concept Set Distribution - OMOP Version — csd_process_omop
title: Concept Set Distribution - OMOP Version — csd_process_omop
text: Concept Set Distribution - OMOP Version

title: Concept Set Distribution - OMOP Version — csd_process_omop
code: csd_process_omop(   cohort,   domain_tbl = conceptsetdistribution::csd_domain_file,   concept_set = conceptsetdistribution::csd_concept_set,   multi_or_single_site = "single",   anomaly_or_exploratory = "exploratory",   num_concept_combined = FALSE,   num_concept_1 = 30,   num_concept_2 = 30,   p_value = 0.9,   age_groups = FALSE,   time = TRUE,   time_span = c("2012-01-01", "2020-01-01"),   time_period = "year" )

title: Concept Set Distribution - OMOP Version — csd_process_omop
text: cohort cohort SQUBA testing; required fields: site person_id start_date end_date domain_tbl input table defining domains listed annotated concept set four columns: - domain name CDM table associated concept; match listed annotated concept set - concept_field name field domain table concepts located - date_field name field domain table date used time-based filtering - vocabulary_field PCORnet ; set NA concept_set annotated concept set CSV file following columns: concept_id required OMOP; concept_id interest concept_code required PCORnet; code interest concept_name optional; descriptive name concept vocabulary_id required PCORnet; vocabulary code - match listed domain table's vocabulary_field variable required; string label grouping one concept code larger variable definition domain required; name CDM table concept stored - multiple domains can included file, one domain listed per row multi_or_single_site Option run function single vs multiple sites single: run function single site multi: run function multiple sites anomaly_or_exploratory Option conduct exploratory anomaly detection analysis. Exploratory analyses give high level summary data examine fact representation within cohort. Anomaly detection analyses specialized identify outliers within cohort. num_concept_combined multi_or_single_site = single anomaly_or_exploratory = anomaly, argument boolean ensure concept1 concept2 meet minimal threshold including jaccard index TRUE, conditions num_concept_1 num_concept_2 met; FALSE just one condition needs met. num_concept_1 multi_or_single_site = single anomaly_or_exploratory = anomaly, argument integer requires minimum number times first concept appears dataset num_concept_2 multi_or_single_site = single anomaly_or_exploratory = anomaly, argument integer requires minimum number times second concept appears dataset p_value p value used threshold multi-site anomaly detection analysis age_groups like stratify results age group,  create table CSV file following columns include age_groups function parameter: min_age: minimum age group (.e. 10) max_age: maximum age group (.e. 20) group: string label group (.e. 10-20, Young Adult, etc.) like stratify age group, leave argument NULL time logical determine whether output check across time time_span time = TRUE, vector two dates observation period study time_period time = TRUE, argument defines distance dates within specified time period. defaults year, time periods month week also acceptable

title: Concept Set Distribution - OMOP Version — csd_process_omop
text: dataframe summarizing distribution code usage user defined variable

title: Concept Set Distribution - PCORnet Version — csd_process_pcornet
code: csd_process_pcornet(   cohort,   domain_tbl = conceptsetdistribution::csd_domain_file,   concept_set = conceptsetdistribution::csd_concept_set,   multi_or_single_site = "single",   anomaly_or_exploratory = "exploratory",   num_concept_combined = FALSE,   num_concept_1 = 30,   num_concept_2 = 30,   p_value = 0.9,   age_groups = FALSE,   time = TRUE,   time_span = c("2012-01-01", "2020-01-01"),   time_period = "year" )

Exploratory analyses give high level summary data examine fact representation within cohort. Anomaly detection analyses specialized identify outliers within cohort. num_concept_combined multi_or_single_site = single anomaly_or_exploratory = anomaly, argument boolean ensure concept1 concept2 meet minimal threshold including jaccard index TRUE, conditions num_concept_1 num_concept_2 met; FALSE just one condition needs met. num_concept_1 multi_or_single_site = single anomaly_or_exploratory = anomaly, argument integer requires minimum number times first concept appears dataset num_concept_2 multi_or_single_site = single anomaly_or_exploratory = anomaly, argument integer requires minimum number times second concept appears dataset p_value p value used threshold multi-site anomaly detection analysis age_groups like stratify results age group,  create table CSV file following columns include age_groups function parameter: min_age: minimum age group (.e. 10) max_age: maximum age group (.e. 20) group: string label group (.e. 10-20, Young Adult, etc.) like stratify age group, leave argument NULL time logical determine whether output check across time time_span time = TRUE, vector two dates observation period study time_period time = TRUE, argument defines distance dates within specified time period. defaults year, time periods month week also acceptable

title: Single Site, Anomaly, Longitudinal — csd_ss_anom_la
text: process_output dataframe output csd_process concept_col name column concept_set used identify concepts either concept_id concept_code filtered_var variable perform anomaly detection filter_concept concept_id interest analysis facet variables like facet graph; defaults NULL

title: Single Site, Anomaly, Longitudinal — csd_ss_anom_la
text: analysis executed year greater, P Prime control chart returned outliers marked orange dots
code: if analysis was executed by month or smaller, an STL regression is     conducted and outliers are marked with red dots. the graphs representing     the data removed in the regression are also returned

title: Single Site, Exploratory, Cross-Sectional — csd_ss_exp_cs
text: process_output output csd_process concept_col name column concept_set used identify concepts either concept_id concept_code facet variables facet ; defaults NULL num_codes integer represent top number codes include mappings exploratory analyses; pick codes based highest count commonly appearing variables; num_mappings integer represent top number mappings given variable exploratory analyses

title: Single Site, Exploratory, Cross-Sectional — csd_ss_exp_cs
text: list two elements: 1) heatmap n concepts (num_codes)  x variables (num_mappings), proportion concept. 2) table mapping total variable count

title: Single Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal — csd_ss_exp_la
text: process_output dataframe output csd_process concept_col name column concept_set used identify concepts either concept_id concept_code facet variables like facet graph; defaults NULL filtered_var variable perform anomaly detection num_mappings integer indicating number top codes filtered_var interest displayed output_value numerical column data displayed

title: Single Site, Exploratory, Longitudinal — csd_ss_exp_la
text: line graph one facet per variable displaying proportion mapped codes across user selected time period reference table total counts code across entire user selected time period
